result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corethious Taylor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corethious Taylor not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Corethious Taylor.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of withdraw of speedy and request for plea and sentencing date. Court grants. Court vacates jury trial on 11-21-2022. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion in Limine and Request for Trial Procedures.
State's Supplemental Witness List, received and filed.
State's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Motion in Limine.  Received and Filed. nk
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND; EXPIRES 01/09/2023.

Defendant Corethious Taylor not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Corethious Taylor.  Defendant's appearance waived. Attorney Daniel T Flaherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and offer and requested SPEEDY trial. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 04; Court scheduled deadline to file final trial documents by October 27, 2022. Final pre-trial scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am. Jury trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Corethious Taylor appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Corethious Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Earl L R or Arneisha M B.

Defendant Corethious Taylor appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Corethious Taylor.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4)
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
